title: Define basic set operations and relations

blocks.name: cdif
blocks.content: Extend class notation to include class difference (read: " ` A ` minus ` B ` ").
blocks.origin: prop class cdif(class c0, class c1) { (c0 \ c1) }

blocks.name: diff.cdif.s
diff.cdif.c
diff.cdif.w
cun
blocks.content: Extend class notation to include union of two classes (read: " ` A ` union ` B ` ").
blocks.origin: prop class cun(class c0, class c1) { (c0 ‚ãÉ c1) }

blocks.name: diff.cun.s
diff.cun.c
diff.cun.w
cin
blocks.content: Extend class notation to include the intersection of two classes (read: " ` A ` intersect ` B ` ").
blocks.origin: prop class cin(class c0, class c1) { (c0 ‚ãÇ c1) }

blocks.name: diff.cin.s
diff.cin.c
diff.cin.w
wss
blocks.content: Extend wff notation to include the subclass relation. This is read " ` A ` is a subclass of ` B ` " or " ` B ` includes ` A ` ". When ` A ` exists as a set, it is also read " ` A ` is a subset of ` B ` ".
blocks.origin: prop wff wss(class c0, class c1) { c0 ‚äÜ c1 }

blocks.name: diff.wss.s
diff.wss.c
diff.wss.w
wpss
blocks.content: Extend wff notation with proper subclass relation.
blocks.origin: prop wff wpss(class c0, class c1) { c0 ‚ää c1 }

blocks.name: diff.wpss.s
diff.wpss.c
diff.wpss.w
difjust
blocks.content: Soundness justification theorem for ~ df-dif . (Contributed by Rodolfo Medina, 27-Apr-2010.) (Proof shortened by Andrew Salmon, 9-Jul-2011.)
blocks.origin:
thm difjust(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wceq(cab(s0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wn(wcel(cv(s0), c1)))), cab(s1, wa(wcel(cv(s1), c0), wn(wcel(cv(s1), c1)))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
} = {
  eqtri(cab(s0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wn(wcel(cv(s0), c1)))), cab(s1, wa(wcel(cv(s1), c0), wn(wcel(cv(s1), c1)))), cab(hs0, wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wn(wcel(cv(hs0), c1)))))
  cbvabv(s0, hs0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wn(wcel(cv(s0), c1))), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wn(wcel(cv(hs0), c1))))
  anbi12d(wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), wcel(cv(s0), c0), wn(wcel(cv(s0), c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wn(wcel(cv(hs0), c1)))
  eleq1w(s0, hs0, c0)
  notbid(wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), wcel(cv(s0), c1), wcel(cv(hs0), c1))
  eleq1w(s0, hs0, c1)
  cbvabv(hs0, s1, wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wn(wcel(cv(hs0), c1))), wa(wcel(cv(s1), c0), wn(wcel(cv(s1), c1))))
  anbi12d(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wn(wcel(cv(hs0), c1)), wcel(cv(s1), c0), wn(wcel(cv(s1), c1)))
  eleq1w(hs0, s1, c0)
  notbid(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(s1), c1))
  eleq1w(hs0, s1, c1)
  diff.wa.s(s0, wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wn(wcel(cv(hs0), c1)))
  diff.wcel.s(s0, cv(hs0), c0)
  diff.wn.s(s0, wcel(cv(hs0), c1))
  diff.wcel.s(s0, cv(hs0), c1)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.w(wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wn(wcel(cv(s0), c1))))
  diff.hs0.w(wa(wcel(cv(s1), c0), wn(wcel(cv(s1), c1))))
  diff.wa.s(s1, wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wn(wcel(cv(hs0), c1)))
  diff.wcel.s(s1, cv(hs0), c0)
  diff.wn.s(s1, wcel(cv(hs0), c1))
  diff.wcel.s(s1, cv(hs0), c1)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm difjust(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1) {
  ‚ä¢ { s0 |(s0 ‚àà c0 ‚àß ¬¨ s0 ‚àà c1)} = { s1 |(s1 ‚àà c0 ‚àß ¬¨ s1 ‚àà c1)}
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c1)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c1)
} = {
  eqtri({ s0 |(s0 ‚àà c0 ‚àß ¬¨ s0 ‚àà c1)}, { s1 |(s1 ‚àà c0 ‚àß ¬¨ s1 ‚àà c1)}, { hs0 |(hs0 ‚àà c0 ‚àß ¬¨ hs0 ‚àà c1)})
  cbvabv(s0, hs0, (s0 ‚àà c0 ‚àß ¬¨ s0 ‚àà c1), (hs0 ‚àà c0 ‚àß ¬¨ hs0 ‚àà c1))
  anbi12d(s0 = hs0, s0 ‚àà c0, ¬¨ s0 ‚àà c1, hs0 ‚àà c0, ¬¨ hs0 ‚àà c1)
  eleq1w(s0, hs0, c0)
  notbid(s0 = hs0, s0 ‚àà c1, hs0 ‚àà c1)
  eleq1w(s0, hs0, c1)
  cbvabv(hs0, s1, (hs0 ‚àà c0 ‚àß ¬¨ hs0 ‚àà c1), (s1 ‚àà c0 ‚àß ¬¨ s1 ‚àà c1))
  anbi12d(hs0 = s1, hs0 ‚àà c0, ¬¨ hs0 ‚àà c1, s1 ‚àà c0, ¬¨ s1 ‚àà c1)
  eleq1w(hs0, s1, c0)
  notbid(hs0 = s1, hs0 ‚àà c1, s1 ‚àà c1)
  eleq1w(hs0, s1, c1)
  diff.wa.s(s0, hs0 ‚àà c0, ¬¨ hs0 ‚àà c1)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, hs0, c0)
  diff.wn.s(s0, hs0 ‚àà c1)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, hs0, c1)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.w((s0 ‚àà c0 ‚àß ¬¨ s0 ‚àà c1))
  diff.hs0.w((s1 ‚àà c0 ‚àß ¬¨ s1 ‚àà c1))
  diff.wa.s(s1, hs0 ‚àà c0, ¬¨ hs0 ‚àà c1)
  diff.wcel.s(s1, hs0, c0)
  diff.wn.s(s1, hs0 ‚àà c1)
  diff.wcel.s(s1, hs0, c1)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
}

blocks.name: df-dif
blocks.content: Define class difference, also called relative complement. Definition 5.12 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 20. For example, ` ( { 1 , 3 } \ { 1 , 8 } ) = { 3 } ` ( ~ ex-dif ). Contrast this operation with union ` ( A u. B ) ` ( ~ df-un ) and intersection ` ( A i^i B ) ` ( ~ df-in ). Several notations are used in the literature; we chose the ` \ ` convention used in Definition 5.3 of [Eisenberg] p. 67 instead of the more common minus sign to reserve the latter for later use in, e.g., arithmetic. We will use the terminology " ` A ` excludes ` B ` " to mean ` A \ B ` . We will use " ` B ` is removed from ` A ` " to mean ` A \ { B } ` i.e. the removal of an element or equivalently the exclusion of a singleton. (Contributed by NM, 29-Apr-1994.)

blocks.name: unjust
blocks.content: Soundness justification theorem for ~ df-un . (Contributed by Rodolfo Medina, 28-Apr-2010.) (Proof shortened by Andrew Salmon, 9-Jul-2011.)
blocks.origin:
thm unjust(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wceq(cab(s0, wo(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(s0), c1))), cab(s1, wo(wcel(cv(s1), c0), wcel(cv(s1), c1))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
} = {
  eqtri(cab(s0, wo(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(s0), c1))), cab(s1, wo(wcel(cv(s1), c0), wcel(cv(s1), c1))), cab(hs0, wo(wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), c1))))
  cbvabv(s0, hs0, wo(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(s0), c1)), wo(wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), c1)))
  orbi12d(wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(s0), c1), wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), c1))
  eleq1w(s0, hs0, c0)
  eleq1w(s0, hs0, c1)
  cbvabv(hs0, s1, wo(wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), c1)), wo(wcel(cv(s1), c0), wcel(cv(s1), c1)))
  orbi12d(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(s1), c0), wcel(cv(s1), c1))
  eleq1w(hs0, s1, c0)
  eleq1w(hs0, s1, c1)
  diff.wo.s(s0, wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), c1))
  diff.wcel.s(s0, cv(hs0), c0)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, cv(hs0), c1)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.w(wo(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(s0), c1)))
  diff.hs0.w(wo(wcel(cv(s1), c0), wcel(cv(s1), c1)))
  diff.wo.s(s1, wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), c1))
  diff.wcel.s(s1, cv(hs0), c0)
  diff.wcel.s(s1, cv(hs0), c1)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm unjust(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1) {
  ‚ä¢ { s0 |(s0 ‚àà c0 ‚à® s0 ‚àà c1)} = { s1 |(s1 ‚àà c0 ‚à® s1 ‚àà c1)}
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c1)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c1)
} = {
  eqtri({ s0 |(s0 ‚àà c0 ‚à® s0 ‚àà c1)}, { s1 |(s1 ‚àà c0 ‚à® s1 ‚àà c1)}, { hs0 |(hs0 ‚àà c0 ‚à® hs0 ‚àà c1)})
  cbvabv(s0, hs0, (s0 ‚àà c0 ‚à® s0 ‚àà c1), (hs0 ‚àà c0 ‚à® hs0 ‚àà c1))
  orbi12d(s0 = hs0, s0 ‚àà c0, s0 ‚àà c1, hs0 ‚àà c0, hs0 ‚àà c1)
  eleq1w(s0, hs0, c0)
  eleq1w(s0, hs0, c1)
  cbvabv(hs0, s1, (hs0 ‚àà c0 ‚à® hs0 ‚àà c1), (s1 ‚àà c0 ‚à® s1 ‚àà c1))
  orbi12d(hs0 = s1, hs0 ‚àà c0, hs0 ‚àà c1, s1 ‚àà c0, s1 ‚àà c1)
  eleq1w(hs0, s1, c0)
  eleq1w(hs0, s1, c1)
  diff.wo.s(s0, hs0 ‚àà c0, hs0 ‚àà c1)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, hs0, c0)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, hs0, c1)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.w((s0 ‚àà c0 ‚à® s0 ‚àà c1))
  diff.hs0.w((s1 ‚àà c0 ‚à® s1 ‚àà c1))
  diff.wo.s(s1, hs0 ‚àà c0, hs0 ‚àà c1)
  diff.wcel.s(s1, hs0, c0)
  diff.wcel.s(s1, hs0, c1)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
}

blocks.name: df-un
blocks.content: Define the union of two classes. Definition 5.6 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 16. For example, ` ( { 1 , 3 } u. { 1 , 8 } ) = { 1 , 3 , 8 } ` ( ~ ex-un ). Contrast this operation with difference ` ( A \ B ) ` ( ~ df-dif ) and intersection ` ( A i^i B ) ` ( ~ df-in ). For an alternate definition in terms of class difference, requiring no dummy variables, see ~ dfun2 . For union defined in terms of intersection, see ~ dfun3 . (Contributed by NM, 23-Aug-1993.)

blocks.name: injust
blocks.content: Soundness justification theorem for ~ df-in . (Contributed by Rodolfo Medina, 28-Apr-2010.) (Proof shortened by Andrew Salmon, 9-Jul-2011.)
blocks.origin:
thm injust(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wceq(cab(s0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(s0), c1))), cab(s1, wa(wcel(cv(s1), c0), wcel(cv(s1), c1))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
} = {
  eqtri(cab(s0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(s0), c1))), cab(s1, wa(wcel(cv(s1), c0), wcel(cv(s1), c1))), cab(hs0, wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), c1))))
  cbvabv(s0, hs0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(s0), c1)), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), c1)))
  anbi12d(wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(s0), c1), wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), c1))
  eleq1w(s0, hs0, c0)
  eleq1w(s0, hs0, c1)
  cbvabv(hs0, s1, wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), c1)), wa(wcel(cv(s1), c0), wcel(cv(s1), c1)))
  anbi12d(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(s1), c0), wcel(cv(s1), c1))
  eleq1w(hs0, s1, c0)
  eleq1w(hs0, s1, c1)
  diff.wa.s(s0, wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), c1))
  diff.wcel.s(s0, cv(hs0), c0)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, cv(hs0), c1)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.w(wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(s0), c1)))
  diff.hs0.w(wa(wcel(cv(s1), c0), wcel(cv(s1), c1)))
  diff.wa.s(s1, wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), c1))
  diff.wcel.s(s1, cv(hs0), c0)
  diff.wcel.s(s1, cv(hs0), c1)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm injust(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1) {
  ‚ä¢ { s0 |(s0 ‚àà c0 ‚àß s0 ‚àà c1)} = { s1 |(s1 ‚àà c0 ‚àß s1 ‚àà c1)}
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c1)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c1)
} = {
  eqtri({ s0 |(s0 ‚àà c0 ‚àß s0 ‚àà c1)}, { s1 |(s1 ‚àà c0 ‚àß s1 ‚àà c1)}, { hs0 |(hs0 ‚àà c0 ‚àß hs0 ‚àà c1)})
  cbvabv(s0, hs0, (s0 ‚àà c0 ‚àß s0 ‚àà c1), (hs0 ‚àà c0 ‚àß hs0 ‚àà c1))
  anbi12d(s0 = hs0, s0 ‚àà c0, s0 ‚àà c1, hs0 ‚àà c0, hs0 ‚àà c1)
  eleq1w(s0, hs0, c0)
  eleq1w(s0, hs0, c1)
  cbvabv(hs0, s1, (hs0 ‚àà c0 ‚àß hs0 ‚àà c1), (s1 ‚àà c0 ‚àß s1 ‚àà c1))
  anbi12d(hs0 = s1, hs0 ‚àà c0, hs0 ‚àà c1, s1 ‚àà c0, s1 ‚àà c1)
  eleq1w(hs0, s1, c0)
  eleq1w(hs0, s1, c1)
  diff.wa.s(s0, hs0 ‚àà c0, hs0 ‚àà c1)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, hs0, c0)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, hs0, c1)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.w((s0 ‚àà c0 ‚àß s0 ‚àà c1))
  diff.hs0.w((s1 ‚àà c0 ‚àß s1 ‚àà c1))
  diff.wa.s(s1, hs0 ‚àà c0, hs0 ‚àà c1)
  diff.wcel.s(s1, hs0, c0)
  diff.wcel.s(s1, hs0, c1)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
}

blocks.name: df-in
blocks.content: Define the intersection of two classes. Definition 5.6 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 16. For example, ` ( { 1 , 3 } i^i { 1 , 8 } ) = { 1 } ` ( ~ ex-in ). Contrast this operation with union ` ( A u. B ) ` ( ~ df-un ) and difference ` ( A \ B ) ` ( ~ df-dif ). For alternate definitions in terms of class difference, requiring no dummy variables, see ~ dfin2 and ~ dfin4 . For intersection defined in terms of union, see ~ dfin3 . (Contributed by NM, 29-Apr-1994.)

blocks.name: dfin5
blocks.content: Alternate definition for the intersection of two classes. (Contributed by NM, 6-Jul-2005.)

blocks.name: dfdif2
blocks.content: Alternate definition of class difference. (Contributed by NM, 25-Mar-2004.)

blocks.name: eldif
blocks.content: Expansion of membership in a class difference. (Contributed by NM, 29-Apr-1994.)
blocks.origin:
thm eldif(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wb(wcel(c0, cdif(c1, c2)), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wn(wcel(c0, c2))))
} = {
  pm5.21nii(wcel(c0, cdif(c1, c2)), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wn(wcel(c0, c2))), wcel(c0, universe))
  elex(c0, cdif(c1, c2))
  adantr(wcel(c0, c1), wn(wcel(c0, c2)), wcel(c0, universe))
  elex(c0, c1)
  elab2g(hs0, c0, universe, cdif(c1, c2), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wn(wcel(c0, c2))), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wn(wcel(cv(hs0), c2))))
  anbi12d(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wn(wcel(cv(hs0), c2)), wcel(c0, c1), wn(wcel(c0, c2)))
  eleq1(cv(hs0), c0, c1)
  notbid(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), c2), wcel(c0, c2))
  eleq1(cv(hs0), c0, c2)
  df-dif(hs0, c1, c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wn(wcel(c0, c2))))
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm eldif(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0 ‚àà(c1 \ c2)‚Üî(c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß ¬¨ c0 ‚àà c2))
} = {
  pm5.21nii(c0 ‚àà(c1 \ c2), (c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß ¬¨ c0 ‚àà c2), c0 ‚àà ùïå)
  elex(c0, (c1 \ c2))
  adantr(c0 ‚àà c1, ¬¨ c0 ‚àà c2, c0 ‚àà ùïå)
  elex(c0, c1)
  elab2g(hs0, c0, universe, (c1 \ c2), (c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß ¬¨ c0 ‚àà c2), (hs0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß ¬¨ hs0 ‚àà c2))
  anbi12d(hs0 = c0, hs0 ‚àà c1, ¬¨ hs0 ‚àà c2, c0 ‚àà c1, ¬¨ c0 ‚àà c2)
  eleq1(hs0, c0, c1)
  notbid(hs0 = c0, hs0 ‚àà c2, c0 ‚àà c2)
  eleq1(hs0, c0, c2)
  df-dif(hs0, c1, c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß ¬¨ c0 ‚àà c2))
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
}

blocks.name: eldifd
blocks.content: If a class is in one class and not another, it is also in their difference. One-way deduction form of ~ eldif . (Contributed by David Moews, 1-May-2017.)

blocks.name: eldifad
blocks.content: If a class is in the difference of two classes, it is also in the minuend. One-way deduction form of ~ eldif . (Contributed by David Moews, 1-May-2017.)

blocks.name: eldifbd
blocks.content: If a class is in the difference of two classes, it is not in the subtrahend. One-way deduction form of ~ eldif . (Contributed by David Moews, 1-May-2017.)
